fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e1.equipments.hem

Class HeaterConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e1.equipments.hem.HeaterConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.ConnectorI, AdjustableCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI

    public class HeaterConnector
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector
implements AdjustableCI
    The class HeaterConnector *manually* implements a connector bridging the gap between the given generic component interface AdjustableCI and the actual component interface offered by the thermostated heater component HeaterCI.

    Description

    The code given here illustrates how a connector can be used to implement a required interface given some offered interface that is different. The objective is to be able to automatically generate such a connector at run-time from an XML descriptor of the required adjustments.

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       currentMode >= 0 && currentMode <= MAX_MODE

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2023-09-19

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      true if the heater has been suspended, false otherwise.
      static double MAX_ADMISSIBLE_DELTA
      the maximal admissible difference between the target and the current temperature from which the heater should be resumed in priority after being suspended to save energy.
      static int MAX_MODE
      modes will be defined by five power levels, including a power level of 0.0 watts; note that modes go from 1 (0.0 watts) to 6 (2000.0 watts).

      the minimum admissible temperature from which the heater should be resumed in priority after being suspended to save energy.

      • getModeConsumption

        public double getModeConsumption(int modeIndex)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: AdjustableCI
        return the power consumption in amperes of the appliance when in the mode modeIndex.

        Description

        According to the good practices for cyber-physical systems, the result of this method should be of type Measure<Double>, as it represents a physical value with a measurement unit. But, as one of the objective of the project is to generate the code of connectors, the limitations of Javassist, the tool used to generate code at run time, that can only compile Java 4 code, it would cause complications to use a class with a generic type.

        Contract

         pre     modeIndex > 0 && modeIndex <= maxMode()
 post    return >= 0.0
        Specified by:
        getModeConsumption in interface AdjustableCI
        Parameters:
        modeIndex - index of the new mode of operation.
        Returns:
        the power consumption in amperes of the appliance when in the mode modeIndex.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        AdjustableCI.getModeConsumption(int)
